Counts for ALA records

Source: R/ala_counts.R
ala_counts.Rd

Takes filters in the same format as `ala_occurrences`, with an additional break down by `breakdown`

ala_counts(taxon_id, filters, geometry, breakdown, limit = 20, caching = FALSE)

Arguments

taxon_id

string: single species ID or vector of species ids. Use `ala_taxa()` to lookup species id.
filters

data.frame: generated by `ala_filters()`
geometry

string: WKT generated by `ala_geometry()`
breakdown

field to breakdown the counts by
limit

numeric: maximum number of categories to return. 20 by default.
caching

logical: should the results be cached/use cache? Only used if `breakdown` is supplied.

Value

either single integer of total counts, or a dataframe of counts by `breakdown` field, if specified.

Examples

# Count of records in the ALA
ala_counts()

#> [1] 91375535
# Counts by state and territory
ala_counts(breakdown = "state")

#>                           name    count
#> 1              New South Wales 25291549
#> 2                     Victoria 18027881
#> 3                   Queensland 14683084
#> 4              South Australia  8024350
#> 5            Western Australia  6645689
#> 6           Northern Territory  4621472
#> 7                     Tasmania  4135218
#> 8 Australian Capital Territory  3456802
